place.name: SKIDBROOKE
place.gazetteerText: SKIDBROOK, a village and a parish in Louth district, Lincoln. The village stands 1½ mile from the coast, and 8 ENE of Louth r. station; and has a post-office under Louth. The parish contains also the hamlet of Saltfleet; and comprises 2,165 acres of land, and 1,290 of foreshore. Real property, £5,331. Pop., 361. Houses, 85. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £271.* Patron, the Rev. J. M. Phillips. The church is old but good; and there are two Methodist chapels. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
